statement.para: There is only one element in \RNr which is neutral with respect to addition.

proof.para: The existence of at least one element 0 which is neutral with respect to addition is guaranteed by the appropriate axiom. If there is one such element, there could be many. So consider an arbitrary element \theta\in \RNr which satisfies a + \theta = a for all a\in \RNr. Then

The identity on the left holds because \theta is neutral, and the identity on the right holds because 0 is neutral. Both identities together say that 0 is the only element in \RNr which is neutral with respect to addition.
